comment: Just take his class. He is a great teacher most of the class is pretty easy to understand.

First class that I've ever left feeling like I understand finance. Explains things so well and provides more resources than any professor I've taken to help practice and understand material. Grades consist of easy final project, 4 exams, homework quizzes, and end-of-lecture questions. If finance isn't your strong suit he will make sure you succeed.
Dr. Brincks is fabulous. I thoroughly enjoyed each and every class period. Four tests at 15% each, three small projects at 10% and attendance grade at 10%. Take him for this course.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Brincks is the best Finance professor I've had. I took both his Computational Finance course and FIN 4620, each was very well-structured. He puts lots of effort into designing valuable course materials and hands-on R projects. Lots of extra credit opportunities. A very amazing professor who genuinely cares about students! Take him if you can!
nice and his optional/ungraded homework is helpful with quizzes and exams as well as his posted online lectures.

Professor Brinks is very knowledgeable in his course of studies. He is great at explaining to the students questions that are asked. He goes through material quickly but will go back and explain if needed. Helpful to attend class, could easily get behind if not. Overall great teacher and informative class.

Brincks is very nice and goes into detail during lectures. This course is very hard, so spend a lot of time with the material. There's I-clicker quizzes for attendance for classes and its 10% of your grade, he offers an extra credit assignment at the end for 1% on top of your final grade. Take him but beware of the difficult material.
Great professor! Gives great lectures and even spends extra time hosting zoom meetings to help you prepare for exams. One of the best professors i've had at KSU.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Brincks is a very nice guy and easy to talk to, but his lectures are very boring and dry. The exams can hard mainly because the lectures are boring and not engaging. He does respond to emails but not very quickly if you do need help.

If you need to take FIN4260, you HAVE to take it with Dr. Brincks. He is by far the best professor I've had in my entire college career. He provides an abundance of resources for you to be successful on exams. He truly cares for his student's success in the class. 10/10 recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Test heavy

comment: You can really tell he cares about his students and is trying his best to make sure they succeed. He spends a lot of his own time  creating extra material, and always acknowledges his mistakes on quizzes and sometimes gives extra credit for pointing them out.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: This is a harder class than average KSU Intro Finance class. However, he's a great professor. He's He care and he's ALWAYS available!! Take take take!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor makes a difficult subject less difficult. This is one of those classes where you will need to utilize all resources. I used his lectures and examples from quizzes and that worked for me. Not an easy A but doable, harder than a average KSU Finance class!!

Great teacher & very nice! Explains really well & doesn't get aggravated when you ask questions. The only real grades are tests, attendance, & quizzes. Quizzes are basically hw though, because you have unlimited amount of time and can use any resource. Definitely more difficult than the average KSU class, but if you do the work it's not hard!!

Dr. Brincks is a great professor. I have had no issues understanding any of the concepts, as long as you go to class and pay attention it is not difficult! He also is happy to re-explain any concepts you are struggling with. His quizzes aren't timed so I go to his office hours if I need help with anything and he is very helpful. Highly recommend!

I think Dr.Brincks is a good professor, and everything is clearly stated in the syllabus. There are a lot of information on his exams. One of the toughest classes I'm currently taking. I compared his exams to friends in other FIN 3100 classes and it is crazy how much harder Brincks is.
His test are hard, contains a lot of information!
